name: Pinned
body:
##Pinned A jQuery plugin for creating "pinned" or sticky elements on a page. ##Features Quickly create pinned elements on page, also support mobile devices such as mobile safari. ##Use 
$("#element").pinned({
	bounds: '100px', // when to become sticky
	scrolling: '0px', // position during scroll
	mobile: false // should support mobile 
});
##Callbacks If you wish you can have callbacks in your code for when your element becomes pinned and unpinned. 
$("#element").pinned({
	bounds: '100px', // when to become sticky
	scrolling: '0px', // position during scroll
	mobile: false // should support mobile 
},function(){
	// PINNED
},
function(){
	// UNPINNED
});
##Methods `$("#element").pinned();` `$("#element").unpin()` ##Unpin Disables the pinned element. ##CSS 
#element {
	position: absolute;
	top: 100px;
}
To use Pinned call the plugin by feeding your element selector, either ID or class, be sure to set your sticky element to position absolute! ##Notes This plugin uses $(window).scroll() and calling unpin will unbind any scroll events that are current bound. Beware when using `$(window).bind('scroll');`
tagline: A jQuery plugin for creating sticky elements
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
